sections.paragraph_title: South city cycling club / Name of club secretary: Jim Hunter

instructions.main_head_001: SECTION 1 - Complete the notes below. Write ONE WORD OR A NUMBER.

questions.text:
Membership
Full membership costs $260; this covers cycling and (1) _______ all over Australia

• Recreational membership costs $108
• Cost of membership includes the club fee and (2) _______
The club kit is made by a company called (3) _______

Training rides
• Chance to improve cycling skills and fitness
• Level B: speed about (4) _______ kph

• Weekly sessions
o Tuesdays at 5.30 am, meet at the (5) _______
o Thursdays at 5.30 am, meet at the entrance to the (6) _______

Further information
• Rides are about an hour and half.
• Members often have (7) _______ together afterwards
• There is not always a (8) _______ with the group on these rides
• Check and print the (9) _______ on the website beforehand
• Bikes must have (10) _______

instructions.main_head_001: SECTION 2 - Choose the correct letter A, B, or C.

questions.text: 11. How much time for volunteering does the company allow per employee?
12. In feedback almost all employees said that volunteering improved their
13. Last year some staff helped unemployed people with their
14. This year the company will start a new volunteering project with a local
15. Where will the Digital Inclusion Day be held?
options: A at the company’s training facility

questions.text: 16. What should staff do if they want to take part in the Digital Inclusion Day?
options: C get permission from their managers

questions.text:
Questions 17 and 18
Choose TWO letters A-E
Which TWO things are mentioned about the participants on the last Digital Inclusion Day?
options: B they never used their computer
C their phones were mostly old fashioned
D they only used their phones for making calls
E they initially showed little interest
correct_answer: C their phones were mostly old fashioned
E they initially showed little interest

questions.text:
Questions 19 and 20
Choose TWO letters A-E
What TWO activities on the last Digital Inclusion Day did participants describe as useful?

instructions.main_head_001: SECTION 3 - Choose the correct letter A, B, or C.

questions.text: 21. Russ says that his difficulty in planning the presentation is due to
options: A his lack of knowledge about the topic.
B his uncertainty about what he should try to achieve.
C the short time that he has for preparation.
questions.correct_answer: B his uncertainty about what he should try to achieve.

questions.text: 22.Russ and his tutor agree that his approach in the presentation will be
options: A to concentrate on how nanotechnology is used in one field.
B to follow the chronological development of nanotechnology.
C to show the range of applications of nanotechnology.

questions.text: 23.In connection with slides, the tutor advises Russ to
options: A talk about things that he can find slides to illustrate.
B look for slides to illustrate the points he makes.

questions.text: 24.They both agree that the best way for Russ to start his presentation is
options: A to encourage the audience to talk.
B to explain what Russ intends to do.

questions.text: 25.What does the tutor advise Russ to do next while preparing his presentation?
options: A summarise the main point he wants to make
B read the notes he has already made
C list the topics he wants to cover

questions.text:
Questions 26-30
What comments do the speakers make about each of the following aspects of Russ’s previous presentation?
Choose FIVE answers from the box and write the correct letter only not a sentence A-G next to questions 26-30

Comments
A lacked a conclusion
B useful in the future
C not enough
D sometimes distracting
E showed originality
F covered a wide range
G not too technical

26. structure: _______
27. eye contact: _______
28. body language: _______
29. choice of words: _______

instructions.main_head_001: SECTION 4 - Questions 31-40 .Complete the notes below. Write ONE WORD ONLY for each answer.

questions.text: • The ability to recall details e.g. the time and (31) ________ of past events
• Different to semantic memory- the ability to remember general information about the (32) __________
•which does not involve recalling (33) __________ information

Forming episodic memories involves three steps:
Encoding
• Involves receiving and processing information
• The more (34) __________ given to an event the more successfully it can be encoded
• To remember a (35) __________ it is useful to have a strategy for encoding such information

Consolidation
• How memories are strengthened and stored
• Most effective when memories can be added to a (36) __________
• The (37) __________ of retrieval affects the strength of memories

Retrieval
• Memory retrieval often depends on using a prompt e.g. the (38) __________ of an object near to the place where you left your car

Episodic memory impairments
• These affect people with a wide range of medical conditions
• Games which stimulate the (39) __________ have been found to help people with schizophrenia

• Children with autism may have difficulty forming episodic memories – possibly because their concept of the (40) ___________ may be absent
• Memory training may help autistic children to develop social skills
